title: State v. Thompson - Violence Risk Assessment for Sentencing
question: Violence risk assessment for sentencing determination
summary: Defendant with Antisocial Personality Disorder assessed for violence risk following conviction for aggravated assault. Pattern of conduct disorder from adolescence, multiple prior assaults, but also protective factors including stable employment history and family support. Structured risk assessment (PCL-R, HCR-20) indicates moderate-to-high risk for future violence. Risk can be mitigated with structured sentencing, treatment programming, and post-release supervision.

documents.description: Comprehensive violence risk assessment using validated instruments
Specific recommendations for sentencing court regarding risk management

key_findings: Diagnosis: Antisocial Personality Disorder, moderate severity
Pattern of conduct disorder beginning age 12 - fighting, theft, school expulsion
Four prior convictions for assault over 8-year period
